title: Neethlingshof 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Dried grass, lemon peel and tart gooseberry set the stage on the nose of this bright wine and carry through to the tart-flavored palate. The mouthfeel is surprisingly rounded in texture, though it's lifted by ample acidity that helps to enliven the finish. Drink now.

title: Parri 2015 Tenuta di Monte  (Chianti)
description: This opens with subdued baking spice and black plum aromas that carry over to the linear palate, along with a hint of clove. It's straightforward and easy-drinking, with smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Petit Tracteur 2016 White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Earthy tones of smoke and dusty mineral blow off to reveal elegant yellow apple and pear fruit here. Despite its dry, light-bodied style, it's pleasantly mouth-clinging and supple in texture. Sprightly acidity brightens its moderately long finish.

title: Poggio Nicchiaia 2015 Filetto  (Chianti)
description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this has subdued black plum and baking spice aromas. The linear palate delivers prune, clove and licorice hints accompanied by relaxed tannins. Drink soon.

title: Pradorey 2017 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Apple, stone-fruit and buttercup aromas are good but basic. This Verdejo is honest and fresh on the palate, but far from complex. Salty apple flavors are reserved, while this tastes of briny apple and melon on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Prototype 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Accents of brown sugar and maple syrup make this full-bodied wine taste almost sweet. A sense of oaky richness is backed by tasty blackberry and boysenberry flavors and a smooth rich texture.

title: Rosemont 2017 Rosé (Virginia)
description: This 100% Chambourcin rosé is abundantly fruity in aromas of watermelon, orange blossom and canteloupe. These characteristics find their way onto the palate, which also delivers an astringent quality of orange peels and apple skins. The acidity adds vigor and leads to a long finish.

title: Saint Sidoine 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This freshly crisp wine has a touch of pepper to complement the red fruits. It is lively, refreshing and offers a tangy, tight aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Salviano 2017  Orvieto Classico Superiore
description: This wine's tropical fruit and peach aromas carry over to the bright, fruity palate, along with green apple, banana and citrus suggestions. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling is extremely shy and reserved at this stage of its life, showing light aromas of damp oak and lanolin. There is decent tension to the sip, where flavors of nectarine, Gravenstein apple and a chalky minerality barely start to show.

title: Stefano Antonucci 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
description: This opens with toast, oak and grilled herb hints. The aromas carry over to the subdued palate, along with roasted almond, grapefruit and butterscotch notes. Drink soon to enjoy the remaining fruit and freshness.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Stone Tower 2015 Wind Swept Hill Red (Virginia)
description: This Bordeaux-style blend starts off with aromas of red plum, cranberry, rhubarb stalk and green pepper. These translate onto the palate, where the char of the oak becomes prominent. While the feel of the wine is well balanced from sprightly acidity and structured tannins, the finish has a bitterness that lingers.

title: Sunset Hills 2016 50 W Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)
description: Soft aromas of grapefruit, lemon, wet stone and moss set the tone for this Sauvignon Blanc. Not in your face in any way, the aromas and flavors are classic yet demure. This is light and bright, with zippy acidity that leaves a tingle on the long finish.

title: Tenuta di Trecciano 2016  Chianti Colli Senesi
description: This has subdued aromas of cooking spices and dark-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate offers black plum and clove alongside relaxed tannins. Drink soon.

title: Tertulia 2015 Riviere Galets Estate Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of raspberry candy, fresh flower, dried orange peel, herb, smoked meat and tire rubber are followed by soft fruit flavors that coat the palate, then taper. Orange-peel notes linger on the finish.

title: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2016 Malbec (Grand Valley)
description: Cranberry, pomegranate and black pepper aromas introduce a lush wine. Gentle tannins and well-balanced acidity add to the easy flavors of juicy red berries and vanilla speckled with peppery spice. The finish is all red fruit, with a whisper of vanilla and white pepper.

title: Three Brothers 2016 Zero Degrees Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: This is enjoyable in its straightforward appeal, offering pineapple rind, crushed stone and Sweet Tart candy tones on the nose and palate. This has a round, ripe feel, with proper balance from citrusy acidity, making this a perfect aperitif.

title: Tuli 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This straightforward approachable wine offers a friendly sense of richness, rounded in lush apple, mango and integrated oak. The finish is bright and fresh.

title: Uggiano 2013 Riserva  (Chianti)
description: This has subdued dark-skinned fruit and culinary spice aromas. The straightforward palate shows black cherry, clove and green peppercorn touches. Drink through 2020.

title: Vins Clémentine NV Coeur Clémentine La Pétillante Brut Rosé Grenache (Vin Pétillant)
description: Sparkling Provence rosé is the logical next step in the success story from the south of France. This one is soft and off dry, making it a great apéritif. It's bubbly, crisply textured and ready to drink.
designation: Coeur Clémentine La Pétillante Brut Rosé

title: Zinfandelic 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Full bodied and nearly sweet, this very ripe and fruity wine smells like waffles and maple syrup and tastes like strawberries and blackberries. Should be good to pair with salty and spicy dishes.

title: Airfield Estates 2015 Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Principally Cabernet Sauvignon (57%) and Merlot (33%) it is finished off with Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. In this red cocoa, cherry, herb, flower and tire-rubber aromas are followed by soft plump-feeling fruit flavors. The tannins bring a slightly gritty feel.

title: Artisan Wines DI Franz Scheider 2017 Pure Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: The freshness of green and yellow apple dominates the nose. The palate has an earthy inflection but is light, bright, vivid and dry. This is refreshing and easy with a very clean finish.

title: Bella Grace 2017 Estate Rosé (Amador County)
description: This pale-pink wine has a light fresh strawberry and mint aroma, appetizing flavors of apple and strawberry on a light smooth texture. It's made from the winery's own Grenache and Mourvèdre vines.

title: Bellini 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: This has subdued baking spice and dark fruit aromas. It's straightforward on the palate, offering Marasca cherry fruit and a sprinkling of clove alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.

title: Bellini 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This has subdued aromas suggesting black-skinned berries, underbrush and cooking spices. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum fruit, with hints of tobacco leaf and vanilla, alongside firm, closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Bianchi 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rounded aromas of Asian pear and citrus show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors combine lemon juice with tart green apple and a bit of nutty warmth.

title: Bindi Sergardi 2016 La Boncia  (Chianti Colli Senesi)
description: This informal red has subdued dark fruit and cooking spice aromas. It's easygoing, with red plum and white pepper flavors accompanied by loose-knit tannins. Drink soon.

title: Boxwood 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Middleburg)
description: This wine is concentrated on the nose with canteloupe, mango, flint and yeast. Equally tropical and intese on the palate, there are playful bursts of necterine and marzipan. It feels creamy and smooth despite its lively acidity. The finish is long and flavorful.

title: Bravium 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a refreshing, narrowly focused wine with lively acidity and firm tannins surrounding tart raspberry and cranberry flavors. Maybe not ideal as a cocktail, but it will make a good foil for roasted birds or beef.
